>Why was the chief repeating this again?

>"Gotta say, you did one helluva job on that house."

>He tapped the photograph of the aftermath, as if you needed a reminder.
>The whole side of the house was blown inward.
>"Exactly three point two seconds later, you KO'd his pet umbreon and had the man in a headlock."
>The chief shook his head dismissively.
>"Good thing you didn't snap the poor lad's neck."
>You winced at the thought of killing an innocent man.
>It's your fault.
>You trusted command got the address right without double-checking.
>"Well, missy, let's all say a big thank you to the big man upstairs, 'cause nothin' short of a miracle just happened."
"Sir?" The timid Lucairo replied.
>"This was nothing short of a slam dunk case against us. No lawyer could've messed this up if they tried."
>"Turns out, Mr. Anon's a very forgiving man."
>For the first time in weeks, your ears perked up in hope.
>"Won't bore you with the legalese, but here's the jist of it."
>"The man could've bankrupted the department twice over, but all he's asking for are some repairs and remodeling. And paying the pet's poke-center bill too."
>"That is, on one condition. And that's why you're here."
>You sat up straighter, eager to help.
>"Bizarre as it may seem, you're our bargaining chip."
>"He insisted you keep your job, first off."
>"Can't say the same for others involved in this clown show."
>"Second, he wants to get to know you better."
>"Wants you to train him, can you believe it?"
>"Says he wanted to meet you a couple hours each day to exercise. And it could only be you."
>You said a silent 'thank you' to Arceus.
>"Now, look, the whole deal rides on this. Made it damn clear there's no alternative."
>"We're all losing our jobs if you don't do it."
>"Now, I can't make you..."
>You didn't hesitate. You nodded furiously.
>"Atta girl."
>"Here's his new address."

>>Also got a lucky Kyurem.

Lucky rate starts at 5% and increases by 5% for each of the birthdays celebrated between the two traded Pokémon, up to 20%.
The lunar new year event bonus also appears to boost that further, I was able to get 24 lucky Pokémon in one day by trading Pokémon 1, 2, or 3 years old.

This event has been great for filling in gaps in my lucky dex.

>>53064489
Slightly higher DPS but significantly lower TDO than Mega Tyranitar.
Still lower DPS than a Rampardos though.

As always, secondary typing and the raid boss' move pool will determine the efficacy of your picks. If using a mega Pokémon for the raid group boost, circumstantially Mega Aerodactyl or Mega Tyranitar may survive longer.

In rock type DPS, Tyrantrum with Meteor Beam is worth consideration, its dragon subtyping will bolster fire resistance, and neutralise grass and water weakness.
Rampardos DPS is amazing but it's too frail to be used effectively in many raids, managing maybe two or three rock slides if you can dodge effectively.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53043330
Hey, that's cool. I was just curious since the threads here always seems collector focus.

Radiant Pokemon are Pokemon that you can only have one of in your deck, but they're have powerful effects or attacks. So it's fun to try and choose which Radiant you want to use or work into your deck. Pic rel is one of the most popular ones, discard pile setup and drawing is really good for a lot of decks.

Radiant Eternatus is the main new one from CZ people like. When you bench it, you can search your deck for any two VMAX Pokemon and bench them as well. Which opens up a lot of opportunities for faster VMAX play.

It's really easy to forget since Ash is the MC but people who make it to the Leagues are the 1% of Trainers. Tons of people just bubble and flounder, and this was specially pronounced back then during the OG anime since they hadn't sanitized things yet and even so there was that one scene of that guy lashing out at Ash because he couldn't make it.
There was tons of characters during OG that said they'd see and met Ash at the League for sure who then simply just didn't make it.
Just look at Gary then. Despite how much of a hotshot he was he ended up choking like a bitch.
Ash consistently placed Top 8 in his league runs. Despite how much people gave shit him for not winning a League IRL that genuinely makes it a 1% Trainer in-story.

>What is it?
https://www.pokeclicker.com/
Pokéclicker is an open-source game built around the story and content of the Pokémon games. This is an idle & clicker type game that is currently in beta release phase. New content and patches are released frequently.

>Crobat?
https://crobat4.github.io/pokeclicker/
A modified version of Pokeclicker that features QoL changes from the original, including a Dock shortcut, type-based pokeball selection, Gen 3+ berries being available in dungeons, un-nerfed experience gains, and some egg-exclusive pokemon being available through other means.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>53054649
Vitamins only benefit the pokemon when it is hatched.
What good is a vitamin on a pokemon, if you don't hatch that egg anymore?
It doesn't do anything but change the time, and points you get from hatching pokemon.

Meaning removing it, won't do anything to the pokemon's stats, unless you want to start hatching the eggs again.

Its good they allow you to reallocate it to a pokemon of which can make better use of it for your hatching habits.

I prefer the dynamic that Grusha hates Larry because of his "normal" act, willingly disregarding all his talent and potential his whole life when some of us had ambitions we had to give up unwillingly. It adds some spice and an excuse to explore what drove them into their niches. What makes Larry feel that being a corporate drone is his only option? Does Grusha fear being chained down to the one career? I feel like they'd be terrible communicating in words, so it'd be things like sharing a love of soba or a refreshingly fast bird flight that appeals to them thinking "he's not that polar opposite from me after all". They sit silently side by side, begrudgingly at first, but neither can stay mad over a warming broth. By the time they aren't grumbling about one another everyone is confused about what happened while they weren't looking, how come those two seem almost friendly now? And then a small spat occurs and their hopes drop.

posts.com:
The lobotomized manchildren will accuse this of being bait but I’m so serious:

If you think that SV’s overworld shinies need an audio and visual cue you are genuinely retarded and shouldn’t be concerning yourself with shinies. If you can’t visually register that a Pokemon is shiny without the game going “Heeey! This is a shiny! This one right here!!!”, you don’t deserve to capture it. SwSh didn’t go far enough by not making mons shiny in the overworld, PLA and LGPE went too far by making them so obvious that they ruin the believability of the overworld, SV handles shinies perfectly.

I found a shiny Shellos, what’s your excuse? If you seriously think the game needs a bold circle around shinies with flashing arrows and airhorns denoting them, maybe a different game is more your speed. This is literally the perfect way to shiny hunt; only casuals, retards, and landwhales have been complaining about “mUh LaCk Of CuEs”, the ‘visual cue’ is that the Pokemon is shiny you massive zoomer autists

Okay Anon, now tell me: why is it that you think they should make the rarest type of Pokemon easy to find? Why are you guys so lazy that you want to be rewarded for doing nothing, not using grand overworld cues is the perfect way to retain the old feel of shiny hunting without just bringing back random encounters. It takes a keen eye and knowledge of the species, it’s not supposed to be easy; making it too easy is where Gens 4-8 started going wrong, with guaranteed shinies and huge unmissable cues, that’s not what shiny hunting is about and I’m sure it’s not what the developers originally wanted out of the shiny mechanic. You think GF would give something such an autistic spawn rate if they wanted the game to hold your hand and force-catch it?

Pokemon with subtle color changes don't even necessarily spawn in group. I've seen Tauros hanging out by themselves or two/three spawning and splitting ways.
I have a Shiny Tauros and seeing a Shiny Tauros at night is pretty hard with the lighting unless you are going crazy focusing on it while hunting.

Shinies should be a pleasure to encounter, they shouldn't have you walk around in the game with wide open eyes and constantly fear of missing a slightly different coloured bunch of microscopic pixels on the ground.

I'd be fine with Shinies not making any sound in the overworld, but I think a slight sparkling animation effect should be constantly around them to make the player sure it's one without having to autistically kill everything in your path and playing with the anxiety of running past a slightly different Shiny.

posts.sub: ITT New Move, Item and Ability Ideas
posts.com:
You love to see it. Always try to keep one of these threads up if I can. I'll start

(Abilities)
>Allergen
When making contact, there is a 30% the attacker/target misses on their next turn. Does not affect Grass-types.

>Double Dip
This Pokemon has a 50% chance to recycle its consumed item at the end of every turn. Doesn't work if that item was destroyed or knocked off

>Frost Heave
Sand Force for Ice moves in Snow

>Whimsical
>Illusionist
>Trickster
Causes Magic / Wonder / Trick Room upon entering the field (respectively). If the matching room is active when switching in, it will be canceled instead.

>Express Delivery
Any moves that involve items have +3 priority (ex. Thief, Fling, Knock Off, Recycle, etc.)

(Moves)

>Sliding Tackle
Normal, Physical, 70bp
Slides into the target, tripping them up and lowering Speed -1. On Grassy Terrain this move gains +1 priority.

>Dust Jacket
Ground, Status
Surrounds the user and their allies in a cloud of protective dust. The user's team is now immune to sand, spore and powder for the next 5 turns

>Dust Bath
Ground, Status
Throws a ball of dust at the target which bursts into a cloud of fine particles and covers them. The target becomes a Ground-type.

>Dust Devil
Ground, Special, 70bp
Can hit Flying-types and Pokemon with Levitate. This also deals SE damage against Flying-type Pokemon.

>Trash Compactor
Poison, Physical, 90bp, 95%
Crushes the target with a powerful force. Has a 30% chance to lower Defense -2.

>Snow Plow
Ice, Physical, 100bp, 90%
The user lowers their head and drives a large pile of snow into the opponent. If there are hazards on the user's side of the field, they are now cleared and this move deals double damage.

>Backdraft
Fire, Physical, 90bp, 95%
25% recoil

>Dismantle
Normal, Physical, 20bp
Removes any screens on the target's side of the field. If hitting a Steel-type, this also has a 100% chance to lower their Def and SpDef -1 each.

A new Pokémon direct will be announced in two weeks, and it will show the following games:
-Detective Pikachu and Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: It's developed by Capcom. Phoenix Wright is isekai'd into the Pokémon world and forms a partership with Detective Pikachu to solve crimes. -Dust of Coronet - A Pokémon story: A new spin-off game with a heavy focus on its story. It tells the story of a young kid who decides to climb Mt. Coronet in search of the Legendary Dust, a relic created by the Pokémon gods that can bring someone back from the dead, and he plans to use it to resurrect his father. It also tells the story of the kid's family (his mother, his two uncles and his absent grandfather), who also climb Mt. Coronet in search for him. It's an action-adventure game, similar to the Uncharted franchise. Each character has a Pokémon (Aipom, Roserade, Cranidos, Weavile and Garchomp) and the player can freely control the trainer or his Pokémon to traverse through the map.
-World of Illusion: The DLC expansion for Scarlet and Violet, it includes 10 new Pokémon, a whole new map, and an exciting history. It will launch on November 20th

posts.com:
So like every guy that sees the dang Vaporeon post, I eventually got really curious and decided to give it a try.

I made us a really big dinner and got us an entire case of Angry Orchard. I used a whole massive bag of chicken tenders, a bottle of Chick-fil-A sauce, and created some of the most amazing loaded nacho cheese french fries you ever tasted.

You have no idea how much this Vaporeon ate. All that fried and greasy food was gobbled up by her. I'd be running to the toilet, but with acid armor this beast just took it all. I was checking something my friend sent me on Discord on my phone, and I didn't notice it used attract on me to get me to put on Family Guy on the TV. Not just any episodes, but the Family Guy Star Wars episodes. I had about a plate and a half worth of food, but while I was getting the TV set up, she gobbled up the rest of the food I made, even slurping up the leftover nacho cheese sauce.

And like you wouldn't think that is a problem. She crawls up on me and lays on my chest, I wrap my arms around her like a pillow, throw a blanket over us and we just watch Family Guy. Well .. it doesn't help she can just spam Focus Energy, which increases her chance to crit.

Every. Single. Time she laughs. Your nose flinches in discomfort. Her breath freaking stinks. It's like a mix of stew, and something you sniff while in a public bathroom. It's gross. It's uncomfortable.

A Focus Band helps prevent a Pokemon from occasionally fainting. And that with Acid armor, protects the Vaporeon. But it still lets out exhaust. Loudly. And if you thought the breath and burps were bad, this monster just ate a massive plate of fried food.

So after the first two specials when she falls asleep on you and rests, you got a farting Vaporeon pinning you down with its bad breath, that drools spit mixed with nacho cheese all over you.

Overall it was not as bad as some of my other dates, but that's not saying much. Does anyone else's Vaporeon like to watch Family Guy?

Ohio used to be a lake so the region is filled with aquatic fossils, people find them everywhere and anywhere. There are plenty of things from Ohio that can be used for an excting Pokémon adventure, not being able to realize that is a skill issue.

Requesters are free to request what they wish, but avoid bumping your request every half hour as it's only going to put people off; try giving it a few hours or more.

Please provide references in ONE image, especially when requesting something outside of the Pokémon universe. If you request something from the old Drawthread or a separate thread, COPY & PASTE the actual request instead of posting a link.

Also, be mindful that requests are done at the discretion of the artists, not on a first come first serve basis.

Please remember to save any piece of art you like from these threads, as we may never know when the archive will start deleting images again. Artists can and are recommended to post their works on other outlets for archival purposes.

>>53036075
>>53029037
I get where you're coming from but it's just excuses, we both know even if you had all your responsibilities removed, your wrist magically healed and were put in an environment where you had nothing to do for entertainment except draw you'd find a reason why you wouldn't.

It's ironic that you mention "retarded drunk child's doodles" because what do you think people think of me? It's just another way to rationalize not drawing so you don't have to face the opinions of other people.

I don't say all this to be an asshole or feed the self-deprecation cope, you can change; you just have to take the first step and trust that the resources and people you surround yourself with can help you be the best artist you can be.

It might come off as a cope to some since i'm seen as a "bad" artist but i think i've made some cool things over the years that wouldn't have existed had i not made a leap of faith.

You just have to believe that one day you're going to be able to fight in the same arena as these people. Thank you for listening to my ted talk.

>>53070770
>Grass/Fire, based off of wildfires, appearance of a living flame wearing a hollowed out, petrified tree. Started out as pure-Grass, but once evolved, it gains its Fire-Typing along with a more vicious temperment.
>Fire/Water, based off of steam trains, transforming mecha, kinda like a transformer. It can between its more agile "Chasedown" form and its powerful "Takedown" form at will.
>Water/Grass, based off of a swamp monster, appearance of a... swamp monster covered in seaweed. It lurks around below the surface of water, ready to capture and devour anything unlucky enough to be in its territory.
>Ghost/Normal, based off of sheet ghosts, it has glowing blue eyes along with ghostly hands that appear from its sheet when attacking. It adores scaring the living daylights out of people, because of this, Pokémon such as Mabosstiff are in high demand.
>Bug/Dragon, based off of tapeworms and wyrms, they start out tiny, but grow to a decently gigantic size. When small, they need to stay inside of their hosts, but will eventually leave when they grow large enough to survive.
>Fairy/Fighting, based off of Angels and Seraphs, this one's a pseudo-legend that gains more wings as it evolves. They usually wear very stoic, unchanging faces, though its apparently not too uncommon for them to show their true emotions around their trainers.
>Pure-Water, based off of crabs (the animal), a little cleanfreak who's foamy bubbles seem to contain a bleach-like quality to them, thus making it favorable for hospitals to have around. It often hunts down Poison-types in packs of 50, so watch out for that.
>Fire/Dark, based off of vampire bats and... vampires, a very haughty species that often looks down on others not of their species. Even with their trainers, they'll only see them as "competent right-hand servants" at best.
Inb4 "mucho texto"

Warseesaw, Normal typing. A rickety wooden rocking horse with a cavalry theme. 50/75/40/40/50. Ability: Insomnia. Evolves at level 18.

Krakoward, Rock/Dragon typing. A makeshift rockpile cavern that easily collapses on itself, with a loud but ultimately defenseless dragon inside. 75/75/60/60/60/50. Abilities: Insomnia/Arena Trap. Evolves at level 39 into Hitmonler if SpAtk is higher than Atk, or Joesteel if Atk is higher than SpAtk.

Hitmonler, Electric/Steel typing. A lithe humanoid creature with all four limbs sprawled out like a crooked windmill, glowing golden electrical arcs for hair and hypnotizing steely blue eyes. 80/80/50/140/50/140. Signature Ability: Pact Breaker, gives all special attacks +1 priority. Signature Move: Heil Storm, Electric-type, 5 PP, base 90 SpAtk damage that increases SpAtk by one stage for every additional unfainted Electric or Steel type Pokemon in the team.

Joesteel, Ground/Steel typing. A churning mass of armor pieces and farming equipment through disrupted soil. 125/100/75/25/50/50. Signature Ability: Lend Lease, produces and immediately consumes a berry at the end of its turn, 25% chance of being a Sitrus Berry, 5% chance of a Leppa Berry, 70% some other random berry. Signature Move: Ground Stall, Ground-type, 50 PP, base 80 Atk, causes opponent to lose 1 PP from all moves if contact is made.

I know this is a coomer thread but reminder that Pokken is actually a good game and you should play it

>Roster It covers nearly every type and a variety of body shapes and popularity levels (shillmons like lucario, pika, zard; popular mons like Gardevoir, Blaziken, Garchomp; more niche favorites like Weavile, Chandelure, Scizor, etc)
>Characters are highly varied in terms of playstyles, both in the sense that two players can play the same character very differently, and that they have varied kits and mechanics (IE braixen and her support cancels/building tools, Aegislash's parry and stance changes and the extra just-frames and buffs you get the more you switch, etc)
>Great balancing, basically every single character is viable in high level play, even characters in low tier still make top 8's all the time
>Mechanics that encourage fundamentals and neutral play where both players are doing mindgames and are trying to get a hit in, such as attack heights functioning as a way for moves to bypass each other and act as reversals, and the 2d-3rd phase shift system causing a return to neutral after shifts and encouraging you to mix up your combo composition and move choices based on if shifting or staying in the current phase is more to your advantage
>Online is still decently active, community still runs tons of events, stuff is centralized around discord.gg/pokken and the supercombo page, no need to join like 12 different servers

I can also give a writeup more specifically aimed at existing fighting game players, but this does touch on some of that already.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53068291
You actually missed something with burst, the activation wave that staggers the other player also resets your PSP guage if it causes the stagger.

The super info you typed up is also a bit overgeneralized: Not all of them are invincible (and it's not the entire active frame duration even when it is) or safe on block , and most can be punished in general with the right response (IE grabbing supers that have counter properties)

But yeah, they are pretty powerful tools. I wouldn't mind seeing them toned down but the only part of it I think for sure should/needs to be is the light hit armor.

I think that'd be a fair change, though as I said, I don't really hate how it works now aside from the light hit armor.

That, the lack of the PSP guage (which dictates when phase shift happens) in the UI, how safe so many of the counter attacks are, and the replay system being ass are really the only major things I for sure want to see changed in a sequel.

I'd also be open to more uses for meter (EX specials, that might also make burst rarer), making the 3d phase retain more of the combat complexity of the 2d phase (so rather then 3d being gundam vs, it's more like Tekken) and Pokemon Stadium style minigames that also teach fighting game concepts, it would be a good way to add some casual replay content/value and also teach people how to time and memorize combos, respond to mixups, reacting and punishing to moves, making reads, etc: The minigames already deal with precise timing, memorization, pattern recognition, etc

I suppose it depends on the Pokemon, their base intelligence.
You'd have some which are smart enough to consent, and some which are not.
Ingame, pokemon evolve far quicker for gameplay reasons. Not only that, but compared to the rigorous, immensely battle focused life of a trainer, most Pokemon would take far longer to evolve.
It also raises the question of whether Pokemon are deliberately kept unevolved by their trainers, until they are mentally capable of handling the increased power given by a new form.
For example, evolving your Growlithe is only a matter of buying a certain rock and putting it on the little tyke.
But then, you have an physically enormous, tremendously powerful entity with the mental maturity of a toddler, or more precisely, a puppy, and the impulse control to boot.
It would be a genuine danger to both your life and others.

Alright, here's two IPS patches for Pokemon Red and Blue. Make sure the versions you use to patch say "(UE) [S][!]". Both versions include Popplio and Brionne.

anonfiles()com/a0C4C8T3yf/pokebrionne_zip

I also poorly attempted to recreate their cries using the gen 1 sound format. You can obtain Popplio from the Mt Moon Pokemon Center via the Magikarp Salesman.

Also I added genders to the game, but they're only viewable in the status screen. Couldn't figure out how to get them to work in battle. I also took this from Shin Pokemon Red but you can hold start to view DVs and hold select to view stat Exp when selecting your pokemon.

Anyways, have fun Brionne lovers. I know I had a lot of fun making it.

Garganacl
Gardevoir

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: I'm excited and nervous about starting Emerald after finishing Crystal. Do you guys particularly concerned with Natures/Abilities/EVs or do you just roll with the punches?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53027277
Depends on the encounter and game state, some pokemon become liabilities with a bad nature, IVs, and movepool; like -SpA Ralts with poor SpA IVs. While fine as a Gardevoir later on due to the huge Base Stat it won't be strong enough to get there as a normal party member considering it's after the fourth badge. Then at the point where you could level it up to use it, you'll have access to other pokemon, hopefully ones with better stat distributions.

Some notable ones with the issue are
>Treecko
The worst starter in terms of early-mid game
>Poochyena
Without a decent Atk/SpA, won't do enough damage until you it before Wattson. Has Howl but is way too frail to use it. Mightyena has some utility however.
>Beautifly
Too weak and limited in moves to handle poor offensive stats
>Lombre and Nuzleaf
They need stats to balance out their awful movepools
>Ralts
As stated above

Then there's the inverse
>Mudkip and Torchic
Decent moves, coverage, and resistances balance out poor stats
>Zigzagoon
Has pick Up and gets early Headbutt which is a STAB 70 power move with a flinch chance, that with Sand-Attack, Tail Whip and Growl gives a way to set up for other pokemon
>Taillow and Wingull
Access to early Wing Attack and Water gun, respectively, are extremely useful and strong.
>Dustox
It doesn't rely on its stats as it's focused on status and support

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
This one cut a little closer than it should have, but 10th game in the challenge is done

Lorelei and Bruno were dealt with Calm Mind sweeps from Slowbro, then instead of risking it through the status effects that Agatha tried to put me through, I pulled out Substitute Raticate. Deny status effects then sweep with Shadow Ball

Things didn't go as planned vs Lance, though. Blogpost incoming
>lead Butterfree to sleep Gyarados so Slowbro can setup
>Gyarados immediately wakes up
>to kill Gyarados and the incoming Dragonair but now Slowbro is at 1/3
>swap to Nidoking
>ice beam city
>freezes Dragonite
>promptly thaws and kills Nidoking with a crit Outrage
Ninetales dealt the final blow but that sucked, now I'm missing a lot of coverage and bulk vs Rival

>lead Raticate vs Pidgeot
>TWave then set up sub on Sand Attack
>kill with Return
>kill Alakazam with Shadow Ball
>Exeggutor comes in and TWave'd
>switch Slowbro and Calm Mind twice
>Ice Beam the eggs
>Gyarados comes in
>crits Bite twice
>leaves me at 20 HP
>in a panic, misplay and switch out, should have just sacrificed him for a free switch
>send out Butterfree
>Toxic then Protect/Psychic until we're both in the red
>predict his Full Restore and put him to sleep in the same turn (felt really good about this one)
>swap into Raticate and set up another sub, then kill with Return
>Charizard comes out and Fire Blasts the sub away
>swap into Ninetales and absorb his next Fire Blast with Flash Fire
>for some reason it Fire Blasts again while I confuse and slowly chip it with HP Electric
>Rhydon comes in
>can't safely switch into anything since Rock Tomb or EQ will kill
>confuse and burn before going down
>send out Raticate
>sub for safety and kill with Return

I had plenty of misplays (including not bringing a 6th to E4) but some of my predictions left me feeling really good, and I can't feel too bad by going all the way with Raticate and Butterfree lol. Rest easy, Mr. Nido and Azsakano.

I think it would probably be better to go with HOME images, since those would be more consistent especially since sprites are no longer guaranteed for all Pokemon and would otherwise have to get sprites from fan edits which could have varying degrees of quality depending on which ones are chosen.

As far as structuring the dex, the basic approach would be to simply list how many Pokemon you want in the dex and then be able to drag and drop Pokemon into the dex. You could add nuances like being able to select an entire evolutionary line or having the dex include inbuilt options for Starters, Regional Birds, Bugs, Rodents, Fossils, Psuedos, etc.

Maybe clicking on the Pokemon images will change them between forms and regional variants or have an option that includes regional variants as separate Pokemon for dexes where perhaps you'd want both to appear.

Maybe include a "Blank" space where user can input their own fakemon although that'd more so be a bonus. You could also have types appear on the Pokemon, maybe have four options; No Types shown, Type Colours as Background, Type Titles and Type Icons, the caveat there would be then that the fakemon option would need to be developed out to be able to customize which types appear on it.

posts.name: Shiny Paradox Hunting
posts.com:
Here's the code for the Union Circle if you want to join : V0M8GW We need a Violet player or two!

In a nutshell I host a picnic at the entrance of Area Zero and you can join it, we all make the same sandwich but only I provide the Herba to save you guys using yours (You will need to provide one ingredient (see pic related) relevant to the type we're trying to get and a condiment, such as salt) and that way by following which types match as seen in the pic we can get paradoxes from both games with one sandwich!

Important notes

If you find a shiny, you can save in front of it, that way if nothing else is found; when we start a new lobby after the sandwich is used up you can reset your game and catch it! This will only work for the person who spawned the shiny.

Try to avoid battling a shiny right away, if you start battle with it and try to run, it will despawn. post in the thread with directions so that someone else can get it. By doing the saving method mentioned in the previous note, two people can get the same shiny!

Best to hunt in seperate areas to avoid overlap, it's good to coordinate where you'll be hunting to help when guiding a player from the opposite version to your location.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53061295
There's only so many things Greninja can do, especially in two turns. So you try to account for everything going wrong as much as possible and then you build a counter. Right now the main things to worry about are:
>Greninja's Turn 0 move, popular opinions are Double Team, Taunt, Swords Dance
>Whether Greninja is Physical/Special/Mixed, most likely mixed to take advantage of STAB Gunk Shot, as well as Priority Water Shuriken
>If Greninja will carry debilitating status moves like Taunt or Haze, and if it will clear debuffs on Turn 1.

So you just try and build something that can cover as many of those options and then a better strategy can be refined after the move set comes out.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53061361
Iron Hands @ Booster Energy
252HP / 252Att / 4SpD
Adamant nature
- Belly Drum
- Earthquake

Corviknight @ Mental Herb
248HP / 8Def / 252SpD
Calm nature
- Defog
- Light Screen / Reflect
- Taunt
- Screech

Turn1:
Turn 0 Swords Dance > Defense Cheer, Taunt, Reflect, Belly Drum
Turn 0 Double Team > Defog, Taunt, Reflect/Light Screen, Belly Drum

Turn 2: Screech x3, Earthquake

This set tries to account for a Turn 0 Double Team or Turn 0 Swords Dance. If the Turn 0 move is an attacking move and chooses Iron Hands, it's pretty much a rap.

The turn order is also set-up in a way that Belly Drum can go off without a hitch. The Defense Cheer on the first Corvinight mitigates the damage for the rest of the team, and the barrier goes up right before Iron Hand's turn. If the Greninja decides to Brick Break on Iron Hands to break the Light Screen/Reflect then it can't close out the kill next turn, even after Belly Drum. The only way it could reliably kill is if it simultaneously +Atk and +Sp,A nature and that's impossible. If it doesn't break the barrier, then it can no longer kill with anything barring crits.

It's not perfect by any means, but it accounts for most of what Greninja could theoretically pull off and barely crosses the damage threshold for a kill, assuming that 7* raids are still 25x HP.

>>53072047
That wasn't me, but for the record here's a couple of the main reasons why you USUALLY don't want to use that spot, video is one month old.

Once you get close, it'll spawn some, but to maximize spawns you'll have to wait a bit.
Once you hit the cap, you can walk back, however as you walk back that despawns the ones at the back, so now the ones closer to you can spawn but those will be at the back as you move, meaning you'll miss some.
Plus it just takes too long at the end if you wait to maximize spawns.

IMO the true best spot is at the third base, from there you go up for like 8 seconds until you reach the path that opens to the left and ends on a big circular island, this place is open enough to see everything around you, nothing can fall, nothing can despawn unless you're super far away and just running a simple circle around it will despawn and respawn mons as the circle is much bigger than the despawn range.
